DataElement.preferredName: Study Protocol Version Application Required Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Specifies whether the modifications contained in the study protocol version must be applied to all sites and subjects that want to continue participating in the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Study Protocol Version Application Required Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._Putting something to a special use or purpose; the act of laying on a substance or preparation.:Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: Putting something to a special use or purpose; the act of laying on a substance or preparation.:Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: A dosing measurement based on the application unit.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2/19/13 Added AIM Foundation Model CSI reference. jc
